argument.name: coords
argument.description: Color coordinates in its color space

member.name: coords
member.description: Coordinates of the color in its color space

member.name: space
member.description: Color space object for the current color.

member.name: spaceId
member.description: Color space id for the current color, e.g. "srgb". Can be used to set the color space, which also transforms the coords accordingly.

member.name: white
member.description: White point of the color's color space. Equivalent to `this.space.white`. Defaults to `Color.whites.D50`.

member.name: luminance
member.returnDescription: The relative luminance of the color

member.name: deltaE
member.description: DeltaE 1976 distance between the current color and another color

argument.name: color
argument.description: The color to calculate DeltaE distance from.

member.name: inGamut
member.description: Is the color in gamut for a given color space?

argument.name: options
argument.description:
Options object. The options supported are:
- **space**: The color space whose gamut we're checking against. Defaults to the current color space.

member.name: inGamut
member.description: Is the color in gamut for a given color space?

argument.name: options
argument.description:
Options object. Options:
- `method`: How to force into gamut. If "clip", coordinates are just clipped to their reference range (don't do that unless you have a reason, it produces very poor results). If in the form [colorSpaceId].[coordName], that coordinate is reduced until the color is in gamut. Please note that this may produce nonsensical results for certain coordinates (e.g. hue) or infinite loops if reducing the coordinate never brings the color in gamut. Defaults to `"lch.chroma"`.
- `space`: Color space whose gamut we are mapping to. Defaults to the current color space.
- `inPlace`: If true, modifies the current color instead of returning a new one. Defaults to false.
